intro: Stachytarpheta confertifolia, commonly known as the clustered verbena, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces clusters of small, two-lipped, tubular flowers in shades of blue, purple, or white, which bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Stachytarpheta confertifolia is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
